author: misterx7348
content: Hey guys, I been here in discussing the EIP1559 but I am also interested in doing some potential work on ETH/ with ETH. I can do python, R and soon Java - what are the required languages and tooling to start with some simple stuff on ETH? Is there a page i can go to?

author: misterx7348
content: I found the website, https://ethereum.org/en/developers/tutorials/, going to see if i can do some of the stuff here ðŸ™‚

author: protolambda
content: <@!725050506808131635> I was just about to say, there's a page full of python things on that site somewhere. It's getting more popular to write smart-contract tests/peripherals in Python, but Python is limited otherwise. For Java things you'll probably want to look at the java Web3 bindings, Besu (eth1), or Teku (eth2).

author: misterx7348
content: Yeah sorry, jumped too quickly on writing something here.

author: protolambda
content: No worries, wish more devs posted here, it's a good place to start here

author: misterx7348
content: Thank you for your reply ðŸ˜„

author: timbeiko
content:
<@!725050506808131635> if you want to contribute to a Java client, you can find Good First Issues here:
Eth1: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/labels/good%20first%20issue
Eth2: https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/labels/good%20first%20issue%20%3Araising_hand%3A
